Articles.Content:
Captains Log:

"We have just exited Kerbin's atmosphere, but while I and Lemler Kerman are excited about the succesful launch, Wehrfrey seems to be concerned about the slight bump we noticed during booster seperation.

I'm sure it's nothing.

Langer out.

"

"Oops"

Funny how everything else was made into dust while the pod stands intact.

You were in a sub-orbital trajectory, right? I assume so because of the speed.

If I am right... gotta use an umbrella, with many struts on it
"Roger that, Langer. We have Jeb here, he said to tell you that if it fell off, it wasn't important."

"Oops"

Funny how everything else was made into dust while the pod stands intact.

You were in a sub-orbital trajectory, right? I assume so because of the speed.

If I am right... gotta use an umbrella, with many struts on it

Sub-orbital indeed, obtained a lot of spin during ascend and stopped the engines when seperating boosters to fix it while going for circularization burn(something was loose i guess, causing the spin, not visible tho)

slaped the throttle to full (i use throttle lever instead of key) and the shock, well, you can see the result

I was rushing the launcher for my new interplanetary ship, basically ended up with an hourglass shape, ship being the upper and launcher in bottom, connected at a single point (with a lot of struts tho)

Edited June 11, 2013 by Neotician
